attributes.action: Allow tax payers to opt out of funding war and fund conflict prevention instead
attributes.background: All UK taxpayers, including corporation tax payers, should have the opportunity to express their conscientious objection to their taxes being used on military and weapons. Instead the amount of their tax which would have been spent on military and weapons should fund conflict prevention programmes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to introduce car parking charges for common land car parks
attributes.background: With an increasing obese population charging to park by common land discourages the access to outdoor activities and discriminates the poorer. The maintenance of car parks in common land car parks should be covered by existing local taxes as it is for parks and children’s playgrounds .

attributes.action: Stop the Experimental Closures on the byways & Droves near Stonehenge
attributes.background:
The public have had access from the A303 & Larkhill to park up and walk around the landscape of our acient Stonehenge free of charge, 24/7. It's the only safe place to visitors can stay free.
We object the refusal of motorized vehicals on the byways that have been used freely for various reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
English Heritage do not provide free 24/7 parking near Stonehenge to view on the free permissive path. 
The reasons for Closure need to be further debated with the public involved who wish to use the byways as usual. 
The report on objections made by the public are going into a report that is not independent from the Government officials and highways

attributes.action: The UK Government to regularly measure household food insecurity across the UK.
attributes.background: It's estimated that millions of people in the UK are food insecure. Food insecurity can vary from worrying about not being able to access enough food to going whole days without eating. Without regular monitoring, we cannot begin to understand the true scale of the problem nor its impact on health.
attributes.additional_details: Emma Lewell-Buck's Food Insecurity Bill would require the government to routinely monitor and report on food insecurity. Trussell Trust food bank statistics demonstrate growing food poverty but there are many more independent food banks and other food aid providers operating today. And we know that help is accessed as a last resort -  most food insecurity is hidden from view. Food insecurity is measured in Canada which means its health implications and long-term costs are understood.

attributes.action: Fund more medical research into Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Neuroblastoma is a Cancer In Children. Mostly under fives. 
It’s the most common form of Cancer In Babies.15% deaths in children.
One in 7000 children are affected.
The treatment is very aggressive and more support for the families diagnosed with Neuroblastoma is needed now.

attributes.action:
Justice for cats
Make it law to report hitting a cat
attributes.background: I lost my cat a few years ago to a taxi car speeding down my road my road s a no through road)  he new he had hit her but carried on to collect his ride. On the way back acknowledging he knew he hit her and left the seen. If she was a dog she would have had rights but cats don’t. Justice for cats.
attributes.additional_details: I love my cats as much as I loved my dog.

attributes.action: Abolish the out dated 'ONE MILE RULE' in the dispensing of medication in England
attributes.background: A Dickensian rule was set in the early nineteen hundreds which states that Doctors prescribe and Apothecaries dispense. Doctors could only dispense if the patient lived more than a mile from the Apothecary (as the crow flies) due to Doctors staff not being qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Now in the 21st century,Doctors dispensing staff are as qualified in all aspects of dispensing and services as the Chemists.The One Mile Rule should now be abolished to fit the NHS White Paper headed PATIENT CHOICE,so that ALL patients in practices throughout the country have the option to choose where they would like their medications dispensed be,it Retail,Online or Doctors Dispensaries.
Therefore by abolishing the ONE MILE RULE, the Government will adhere to the heading of the NHS White Paper

attributes.action: Offer a biopsy to all women referred to a breast cancer clinic
attributes.background: I want every women referred to a breast clinic with a lump in there breast to have a biopsy rather than an ultrasound so they can be told 100% if the lump is cancerous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife went to a breast clinic with a lump in her breast where the consultant only did a ultrasound and not a biopsy. She was told it definitely wasn't cancer. They never did anymore investigating in to her lump as they didn't think it was cancer. Three years later the same lump got a biopsy and it was cancer. My wife lost her life because she didn’t get a biopsy to tell us 100% if it was cancer.

attributes.action: Government to adopt a single comprehensive measure of poverty as standard
attributes.background:
Government does not have an official standard measure of poverty and currently uses measures based simply on mean income.
This is not an accurate measure of poverty. We demand parliament legislate to adopt a comprehensive measurement similar to or the same as Social Metrics Commission measure.
attributes.additional_details:
The current government measure of poverty uses 4 different measures based simply on mean income.

Considering stagnated wages, rising costs, homelessness rising, impact on disabled people, rising childcare costs, overcrowded housing etc. These issues should always be taken into account when measuring poverty, not just a mean income.

We, therefore, think this parliament should legislate adopt the same as or similar to the Social Metrics Commission new measurement of poverty as a set standard.  (see below)

http://socialmetricscommission.org.uk/MEASURING-POVERTY-SUMMARY-REPORT.pdf

attributes.action: Create a UK wide waste and recycling system.
attributes.background: The current waste and recycling system is broken down into counties or smaller regions of the country which are able to recycle different products, have different coloured signage, and for the most part a complete lack of public reycling facilities.We could be recycling more and not adding confusion
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government has said it will reduce plastic waste and increase recycling rates. This coupled with China no longer taking plastic waste means that more needs to be done to recycle items in this country. Currently councils are only able to recycle certain items meaning that a lot of recycling across the country actually ends up in landfil/waste to energy.We need one system for the whole country so that no matter where you are it is clear which bin an item should go in and it will be recycled

attributes.action: Allow students' placements to count towards 30 hours funded childcare criteria
attributes.background:
Students studying a degree with an integrated placement are required to have more contact hours than those without therefore for parents, childcare can be difficult to fund.
University limitations of number of hours students can work mean additional income to fund childcare is difficult to obtain.
attributes.additional_details:
It is grossly unfair that placement hours are not considered when deciding who should qualify for the additional funding.

This petition calls for the government to have a review of the guidelines regarding the eligibility of the additional 15 hours funded childcare for three and four year olds, and to introduce new criteria that allows students with integrated placements within their degree to have their placement hours taken into account when applying for additional funded childcare.

attributes.action: Ban average speed cameras due to them being a distraction for drivers.
attributes.background: Highways England have declared that an incredibly realistic looking 'dummy' average speed camera is distracting and therefore is unsafe for the public, and have requested Bedfordshire county council have the camera removed.
attributes.additional_details:
By stating this, it stands to reason all average speed cameras are unsafe
 
Given the similarities between the dummy camera and normal average speed cameras, I believe Highways England have effectively stated all average speed cameras are distracting. 

The government rightly outlawed the use of mobile phones behind the wheel because they are distracting. It is therefore reasonable for all average speed cameras to be banned.

attributes.action: Remove forced adoption from Britain
attributes.background: In Ireland, France and Spain forced adoption is illegal; in Britain, it is not. Why have we got less parental rights?
attributes.additional_details:
The role of social services is to support families and protect children from abuse, that shouldn't include taking children away from their parents with no proof of abuse, and without trying to work with families; these children are being separated from siblings and put at much more risk. The children are then getting put up for adoption with family members still fighting to keep them; babies and toddlers are getting put up for adoption extremely fast without parents being found guilty of anything.

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/couple-cleared-child-cruelty-reveal-6599877

https://forced-adoption.com/what-you-can-do/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to have compulsory logo trousers, skirts or shirts
attributes.background: Many schools and academies are adding expensive logo trousers, skirts and shirts to their uniforms, for example increasing the cost of school trousers from £4.50 to £19.95. Often the opinions of parents are ignored, and families have to pay these large bills or face having their children excluded.
attributes.additional_details: If you wish to see evidence of this, look at the cost of uniform providers such as Just Schoolwear or Schoolwear Solutions for logo items. Then compare to a high street retailer such as George, Tesco or Sainsbury.

attributes.action: Introduce a legal right to paid time off for all women who miscarry a pregnancy
attributes.background: Women who miscarry within maternity leave time are entitled to their maternity leave and full 6 weeks’ pay if required. If outside of this time, women can be left with weeks of physical problems and emotional stress.
attributes.additional_details: The physical strain on a woman’s body during a complicated and incomplete miscarriage can be dangerous. These women need to be sufficiently supported and entitled to paid time off for appointments and recovery.

attributes.action: Make parking in a disabled bay on private land without a Blue Badge illegal.
attributes.background: Unlike on-street Blue Badge parking bays it is not a criminal offence to use disabled parking bays on private land without a valid Blue Badge. The law needs to be changed so that offenders can be fined and/or points added to their license. This will prevent misuse in places like supermarkets.

attributes.action: Establish a national day commemorating the significance of 15th August 1945.
attributes.background: Thousands of servicemen were held as Far East prisoners of war from 1941-1945, caught up in a conflict that endured long after the celebrations for VE Day. The contribution of those who had the misfortune to be held as pows, many of whom did not survive, deserves to be remembered nationally.
attributes.additional_details: Over 50,000 UK servicemen were held as Japanese prisoners of war in South East Asia between 1941-1945, of whom twenty-five per cent were either killed or died during captivity. With few survivors now left, this conflict is fast disappearing from living memory. These brave men felt cruelly overlooked upon their repatriation and beyond, and a national day of commemoration would go some way to putting that right.

attributes.action: Stop Capita PLC bidding on public sector work & review all current contracts
attributes.background:
There have been widespread reports that suggest Capital is not fit for purpose. 
 
Reports suggest over 50,000 women had not received a smear test letters as well as mismanagement of GP pensions and Windrush.
attributes.additional_details:
If Capita collapse they have a “living Will” to safeguard current projects.
 
http://www.nationalhealthexecutive.com/Health-Care-News/we-have-lost-all-confidence-number-of-women-affected-by-capita-cancer-screening-scandal-rises-above-50000
 
https://www.gponline.com/capita-stripped-pcse-contract-immediately-say-lmcs/article/1519533
 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/may/08/home-office-told-of-windrush-errors-five-years-ago-experts-say
 
https://www.theregister.co.uk/2018/11/20/uk_government_suppliers_living_wills/

attributes.action: Provide separate labour wards for women giving birth to stillborn babies.
attributes.background: I gave birth to my dead baby boy on a maternity ward 17 years ago surrounded by crying babies. It was soul destroying knowing others were celebrating new life, when a life had been taken from me. Future mothers should never experience this tragedy and is why I am calling for legislative change.
attributes.additional_details:
According to stillbirth charity 'Tommy's Organisation', one in every 225 births ends in stillbirth in the UK - making that nine babies every day. It's also estimated that 4.2 million are living with depression associated with previous stillbirth - a number which cannot go ignored.

It's imperative to change the future of these bereaved mothers by creating the best environment possible for one to give birth to a dead child, and to ensure we provide the tools to be able to cope with such a loss.

attributes.action: Prevent Freeholders from passing cladding costs to leaseholders
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 72 people lost their lives in the Grenfell Tower fire in London.  Thousands of people are still living in tower blocks with unsafe cladding over a year later. Over 400 high-rise flats still have the same type of cladding blamed for the rapid spread of the deadly blaze.
attributes.additional_details: Leaseholders are forced to pay £millions to fix cladding and more, costs unfairly passing to us even though we were not responsible for construction or approvals. Our homes won't be made safe until funds are in place. Our flats are also unsellable and unmortgageable until works are completed, We call on parliament to make it illegal to pass on any costs related to making our homes safe, to compensate those of us who've paid for works and to require homes be made safe as soon as practicable.

attributes.action: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome.
attributes.background: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome. This is not actually an optical problem but a problem with the way the brain processes visual information.
attributes.additional_details: They aren't available on the NHS as the prescription is a colour, not curved glass, leaving the parent to pay for a test to find the correct shade and depth of colour, the frame and the lenses, costing about £250+ plus regular assessments To read, write and reach their potential these children NEED their glasses but are penalised due to their prescription. Glasses for Irlens Syndrome are vital to their education and should be provided on the NHS just like any other children's glasses.

attributes.action: Pressure Kingdom of Saudi Arabia not to execute a female civil right activist.
attributes.background: Israa Al-Ghomgham is an activist who participated in and documented the mass protests that have taken place in Qatif province in Saudi Arabia since 2011. She is currently facing the death penalty and is due to be beheaded by a public prosecutor of the KSA.
attributes.additional_details:
Saudi Arabia is taking the rare step of seeking the death penalty for a 29-year-old female activist accused of encouraging demonstrations for greater rights for the Shiite Muslim minority, the advocacy group Human Rights Watch said. 
Beheading Ms Israa Ghomgham for conducting peaceful protest is a barbaric act that violates both British and Universal values of basic human rights. We demand that the British Government put maximum pressure on the KSA to stop this barbaric act.

attributes.action: If there is a vote on the final EU deal then there must be no option to stay in
attributes.background: If there is a referendum on the final deal with the EU then the options must be simply deal or no deal. There must be no option to stay a member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: It was clearly stated in the pro EU booklet: 'This is your decision. The government will implement what you decide.'   The once in a generation decision on whether we want to be in the EU or not has already been made, we voted to leave and that must be respected either way whether or not we can get a good deal and there must be no option to stay a member in any vote on the final deal.

attributes.action: Ban the use of face coverings at protests and counter protests.
attributes.background: It has became common practice for protesters to attend protests with their faces totally covered. With the sole aim of causing trouble and escaping police prosecutions. The police rely heavily on video footage to enable prosecutions at later dates and away from a hostile crowd.
attributes.additional_details:
Being able to cover ones face empowers people to commit crimes of assault, criminal damage, racial abuse, etc, that they may not otherwise commit. Much the same as a fake profile online empowers people to say things that they would be to afraid to say on a real profile. 
A law would greatly aid the police in doing their job and keeping the peace at public protests and counter protests. I feel it would reduce the number of offences committed at protests considerably.

attributes.action: Create new laws around letting agents to ensure students don’t get overcharged
attributes.background: Many students get overcharged when leaving their properties because it is very easy to become blinded by the confusion of the big wide world. I want laws to be changed so landlords/letting agents cannot try to charge ridiculous prices for basic things like cleaning and painting.
attributes.additional_details: I have been charged over £1000 for leaving my property after my 2nd year at University for just cleaning, gardening and painting. I have started a Facebook petition reaching out to other students and so far I have over 300 cases. I feel that it’s too easy for students to fall into these traps and accept these charges, as we do not understand the full breakdown of these costs. There needs to be a law to ban landlords and letting agents charging more than 10% mark up on services at the end of tenancies. Students are being exploited.

attributes.action: Question Cameron's decision to impose fundamental constitutional change
attributes.background: This nation is a representative democracy or at least it used to be. Then in 2016 David Cameron imposed a regime favoured by dictators and demagogues: decision by dint of a misinformed public–a referendum. An inquiry is needed to find out why he decided to impose fundamental constitutional change.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is in a political crisis brought about by the transfer of supreme authority from the electorate to the government. It is not true to say that the people decided to leave the EU, because that claim presumes that the electorate has followed the government's instruction that they must make the decision. For the government to instruct the electorate on how to vote & then instruct Parliament on how to interpret that vote is fundamentally undemocratic. Why was that instruction issued?

attributes.action: Make youths in further education eligible for a free bus pass
attributes.background: In England, citizens aren’t eligible for a free bus pass until they reach the state pension age. For a yearly bus pass for anybody else, it’ll cost £592, money that most teenagers and young adults don’t have. Without bus passes, many people would be unable to travel to college and university.
attributes.additional_details: There is a need for youths to have bus passes as it becomes increasingly difficult to access education as you grow older. On top of university fees, bus fees will also have to be paid. Lots of teenagers don’t have jobs or work on minimum age which can make it impossible for them to reach their college, sixth form or university. Students who have just started college (age 16) are unlikely to be eligible for a free bus pass until 2070 when they will be more than done with education.

attributes.action: Scrap smart motorways and bring back the safety of the hard shoulder.
attributes.background: When your vehicle has issues on a motorway, you look for the safety of the hard shoulder. Smart motorways have removed this and are not smart enough to recognise lane 1 blockages quick enough. As a consequence, lives are put at imminent risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the implementation of motorways, there has always been a hard shoulder which served several purposes. It is a safe zone for a vehicle to use if there's a mechanical problem, if there is a sudden emergency and more so, it was a clear lane for emergency services to use. 

Since the implementation of smart motorways, this lane has become a live lane and if the unforseen happens, you are stranded in what is now a death trap and also delaying emergency vehicles attending an incident.

attributes.action: Increase funding to Staffordshire Police to protect villages from car crime.
attributes.background: Small villages in Staffordshire are being targeted for car crime as they are seen as easy targets due to the lack of visible police coverage. Stations are being closed and police are having to travel over an hour to reach scenes and take arrestees to stations.
attributes.additional_details: The Facebook page Wombourne Online is reporting car crime at least 4 times a week - including violent targeted thefts where homeowners are being threatened for this cars. The police are stretched to breaking point and need more resources.

attributes.action: Ban single-use cups in cafes when customers are 'eating in'.
attributes.background: This is unnecessary consumption of paper and plastic resources. Very few single-use cups can be, or get recycled. For customers who are drinking their drinks on the premises, cafes should be required to use mugs / ceramic cups and wash them up.

attributes.action: Bring back Appeal rights & Right to work for migrants
attributes.background:
Under Immigration Act 2014, most migrants lost their right of appeal -that took their basic rights away - like Access to employment, NHS & much more. These are some of the basic needs a person requires to sustain one self. 
This has lead to many migrants living in destitute conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of windrush incident,many of us are now awake as to what is happening in the society we live in.The whole country was left in shock. The migrants suffer everyday with these hostile policies.

We have recently seen a case of a Nigerian woman who despite facing difficulties got justice thru the courts. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/aug/21/court-says-seriously-ill-woman-can-work-while-fighting-uk-deportation

Please help in bringing back basic needs for these migrants.

attributes.action: Make it law that gluten free food in restaurants is not contaminated by gluten.
attributes.background: Food safety law in the UK is not strict enough around how gluten free food is made in restaurants. Restaurants offering gluten free options should have to ensure those meals are made in controlled environments, so the food cannot be contaminated by gluten which would make it unsafe for coeliacs.
attributes.additional_details: Coeliac disease is a serious auto immune disease affecting 1 in 100 people in the UK. Upon minimal contact with gluten the immune system is triggered to attack the bowel lining, which can happen without any noticeable symptoms. By law foods labelled ‘gluten free’ must contain no more than 20 parts per million gluten, but if restaurants do not take care to prevent kitchen contamination gluten free meals are likely exceeding this safe level and triggering an immune reaction in coeliac sufferers.

attributes.action: Utilise Reading Prison as a Shelter for the Homeless
attributes.background: Reading currently has the highest number of homeless not only in Berkshire but in the South East; as taxpayers we're already paying for this building to be heated, the lights kept on and the water running, it just makes sense when there are people, our people, outside in the cold, wind and rain.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2013, Reading Prison which has a potential capacity to hold over 500 people, that has running water and still being heated, is just lying empty. 

So far it has cost the taxpayer in excess of a £1 Million to mothball. Unused for the last 5 years (save an art exhibition and the odd film production company using it for shooting locations), it seems to me almost criminal, when so many are in need of warmth and shelter to not utilise this for those of who find themselves homeless.

attributes.action: Force providers to supply the free to air tv channels on bedside tv sets.
attributes.background: Charging hospital patients who have no other means of entertainment, a fee for supplying free to air tv channels should be stopped. It is unfair to charge anyone to watch free to air channels.

attributes.action: Make Zoroastrianism a part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Schools should teach pupils about Zoroastrianism. It is one of the world's oldest active religions. It is the first monotheistic faith centered in a cosmology of good and evil and an eschatology predicting the ultimate destruction of evil. Ascribed by Zarathustra who lived almost 3,500 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Zoroastrianism enters recorded history in the 5th-century BCE. It served as the state religion of the pre-Islamic Iranian empires for more than a millennium, from around 600 BCE to 650 CE.  Zoroastrianism was suppressed from the 7th century onwards following the Muslim conquest of Persia of 633–654. In 2015, there were reports of up to 100,000 converts in Iraqi Kurdistan. Zoroastrianism has influenced the Second Temple Judaism, Gnosticism, Christianity, Islam, and Buddhism.

attributes.action: Exempt ALL NHS Healthcare Professionals from the Minimum Earnings Threshold
attributes.background: Non-EU citizens seeking Indefinite Leave to Remain the UK are required to earn £35,000 a year. In an era of austerity, when our NHS is stretched and there are vacancies across all healthcare professional roles, it is both immoral and unethical that we send highly committed and skilled workers away.
attributes.additional_details:
Allied Health Professionals are the 3rd largest workforce in the NHS and without them most patients would not be able to return to their homes and be as independent as they are
https://www.england.nhs.uk/ahp/about/

Of the 1.2 million staff in the NHS almost 10% are from Non-EU countries
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-7783

At present there are 4000 Physio vacancies in the NHS
https://www.csp.org.uk/news/2018-06-14-csp-seeks-answers-visa-exemptions

attributes.action: Remove legal privilege from the PHSO so police can investigate misconduct
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman has legal privilege which means that the police cannot look at their case files to investigate allegations of staff misconduct in public office. The PHSO investigates the death of our loved ones but the police have never been able to intervene.
attributes.additional_details: The PSHO should not appear to be above the law. During the investigation into the death of my son, I believe that staff didn’t do their jobs correctly which led to a flawed report and decision. I’ll never be able to know for sure however because the police are not able to investigate. This means I will  never know the truth behind my son’s death. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Order immediate adjournment of the Brexit process during the NCA Investigation
attributes.background: The NCA is investigating criminal offences relating to electoral law on the behalf of Brexit supporting campaigners.
attributes.additional_details:
This is serious enough to warrant a view that the 2016 referendum result should be questioned.
 
Therefore the process should be adjourned while the facts and position are investigated.
 
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/news/1498-nca-initiates-investigation-following-electoral-commission-referral
 
https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/our-work/roles-and-responsibilities/our-role-as-regulator-of-political-party-finances/sanctions/report-on-investigation-into-payments-made-to-better-for-the-country-and-leave.eu

attributes.action: To ban to use of deep confinement booths in schools.
attributes.background: Deep confinement or isolation booths are used in many Primary and Secondary Schools as part of a Behaviour Management Strategy. The use of these booths is unregulated and unreported. They are a breach of the UN charter on the rights of the child.
attributes.additional_details:
Deep confinement booths have been removed from custodial settings. Recent evidence shows that in 500 schools using isolation booths 200 children had spent more than 5 days in isolation in the past year. There is no evidence that these booths or extended isolation have any positive effect on behaviour. There is a great deal of evidence to the contrary.

We believe that the booths are full of children with SEND and will be disproportionately occupied by BAME children also. 

The campaign is not against removal or separation. Neither is it about desk dividers. We want the booths outlawed and regulation of isolation for all schools.

For more information please visit www.banthebooths.co.uk.

attributes.action: An Opt Out system with the Bone Marrow Register and more awareness in Education.
attributes.background:
Every day at least 5 people start their search for a bone marrow donor. There are currently only 2% of people in the UK registered. This compares to 13% in Cyprus, 12% in Israel and 9% in Germany.
90% of donations take place via peripheral blood stem cell (PBSC) collection, similar to giving blood.
attributes.additional_details:
Organ donation is highlighted with public campaigns as is blood donation. Both saves lives. Bone Marrow Donation is not. It needs more public awareness, more understanding within the communities and schools. It must be made compulsory within the school age of 14-16 years. It can reduce concerns and highlight the simplicity of the procedure, which will potentially save someone's life ! 
There should be an 'Opt Out' system where those who wish to not donate can remove themselves from the register.

attributes.action: Stop animals being used for street entertainment in order to gain money
attributes.background:
Animals are being used by buskers to gain money should be banned!
Animals are being abused, and treated cruelly
Any animal being used for street entertainment should be jailed and dogs siezed
attributes.additional_details: Dogs have been siezed by the rspca for abuse, ill health over the past two years already 17 dogs have been siezed, some through heat exhaustion, urine infections due to not being allowed to pee in the same place, they are wacked by their leads, water bowls are for show only, they are beaten back at base and also drugged this is no life for any animal, this has to stop!!

attributes.action: Prevent payment of EU ‘exit fee’ until a beneficial trade deal has been ratified
attributes.background:
The Government has offered to pay up to £39bn to the EU as an exit fee despite there being no legal requirement to do so.
Put it into law that not a penny should be paid until a final trade deal with demonstrable benefits to the UK economy has been signed and ratified by all EU member states.

attributes.action: Slash Home Office settlement and naturalisation fees: stop making a huge profit
attributes.background: Home Office charges £2,389 for indefinite leave to remain (per person for the main applicant and every dependant) a rise of 25% on 2016-17. It costs £243 to process each application. The settlement visa for an adult dependent has risen from £585 in 2008-09 to £3,250 in 2017-18, an increase of 450%.
attributes.additional_details:
Fees for immigration and nationality applications have steadily risen since 2010 including in the latest round of changes in April. 
Figures released to the BBC showed the Home Office made £800m in revenue from fees in six years. 
The Home Office made profits of up to 800% on some immigration applications from families. 
References : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jun/24/reduce-home-office-fees-say-mps-campaigners

attributes.action: Make education about littering and its effects compulsary in all schools.
attributes.background: My name is Osian,  I am 17 and have Autism and anxiety.  I have volunteered in the Peak District for 4 years. The peace of the moors has saved my life and I want to do all I can to protect them.   The epidemic of littering and fly tipping is ruining the countryside and is a danger to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: I am the National Trust Youth Volunteer for 2018 and want to use my award to promote my campaign. I believe that the only way to make a real difference with litter is to start with children.  I hope that they will grow up and teach people around them to also not drop litter. What we learn as a child we never forget.  I want every child to participate in an education programme that will result in a Certificate from the Government and sign a promise to not drop litter and look after their world.

attributes.action: Counsellors on wards where 16 to 25-year-olds are receiving cancer treatment
attributes.background: Counsellors should be available for young people receiving cancer treatment. When I was diagnosed with cancer, it was a complete shock for me and my family. I found it harder to deal with mentally than the actual treatment itself.
attributes.additional_details: Despite being treated on a specialist adolescent unit for 16 to 25-year-olds, no counsellor is available for people in this age group. I and others would benefit from a counsellor being on wards and instantly available. The counsellor could then deal with any worries as they arise, and people would not need to wait for appointments in the community.

attributes.action: Drop the EU Withdrawal Agreement on the basis that it is unconstitutional.
attributes.background: The EU Withdrawal Agreement (EUWA) stipulates that we will have no representation in the EU Parliament while mandating we still pay VAT at rates limited by the EU. This means British citizens will be taxed without representation which is unconstitutional and may set a "taxes for deals" precedent.
attributes.additional_details: VAT was introduced on joining the EEC. It replaced the similar Purchase tax to avoid double taxation. VAT is therefore an EU mandated tax, irrespective of whether the EU is the main beneficiary or because it's collected by HMRC. The EU control the rate for competition reasons between member states and will retain ultimate jurisdiction in the UK over it. This is not a petition to "get rid of" VAT, but against the ramifications and precedents the EUWA may have on our fundamental rights

attributes.action: Redistribute 30 hours childcare funding to subsidise costs for children aged 1-4
attributes.background:
The current childcare funding is not available until a child is three years old. Consequently, there is a funding gap between the end of maternity leave and the start of the 30 hours funding. 

I propose we redistribute the funding to provide 15 hours childcare per week for children aged 1 to 4.
attributes.additional_details:
All parents are eligible for 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

Families where both parents are working are eligible for an additional 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

The current gap in childcare funding for children aged 1 and 2, means that childcare costs are one of the greatest barriers for parents returning to work. 

I propose we redistribute this entitlement so that families where both parents are working are eligible for the funding for children aged 1 and 2.

attributes.action: Suspend foreign aid until the national debt has been payed off.
attributes.background: We have a national debt to service, if we give 14.5 billion by 2021 in foreign aid we are borrowing money to give away whilst we lack funds for domestic programs

attributes.action: Confirmed date for National Rollout of voluntary right to buy
attributes.background: There have been numerous regional trials for the VRTB which have all been used to stall a national roll out of the scheme. Our voices are ignored, all question go unanswered. It's time we were given the same rights as council tenants as promised in the Government's 2015 manifesto.

attributes.action: Press the United Nations to make the dumping of all waste in the oceans illegal.
attributes.background: The only way to stop the polution of the oceans by plastic and other waste is to stop the dumping of urban waste at sea. The attempts that are being made to remove plastic and other waste from the oceans will only start to be effective once the dumping has stopped.
